item.title: Aligner: Efficient Alignment by Learning to Correct
item.description: Aligner efficiently aligns LLMs by learning to correct initial responses, achieving significant improvements in helpfulness and harmlessness across various models with resource efficiency.

item.title: Buffer of Thoughts: Thought-Augmented Reasoning with Large Language Models
item.description: Buffer of Thoughts (BoT) boosts Large Language Model reasoning by storing and reusing high-level ’thought-templates’, achieving significant accuracy and efficiency gains across diverse tasks.

item.title: MotionBooth: Motion-Aware Customized Text-to-Video Generation
item.description: MotionBooth: A new framework enabling precise control over both object and camera movements in customized text-to-video generation, achieving high-quality video while maintaining training efficiency.

item.title: PiSSA: Principal Singular Values and Singular Vectors Adaptation of Large Language Models

item.title: SegVol: Universal and Interactive Volumetric Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: SegVol: A universal, interactive 3D medical image segmentation model achieving state-of-the-art performance across diverse anatomical categories.

item.title: SpikeReveal: Unlocking Temporal Sequences from Real Blurry Inputs with Spike Streams
item.description: SpikeReveal: Self-supervised learning unlocks sharp video sequences from blurry, real-world spike camera data, overcoming limitations of prior supervised approaches.

item.title: Statistical Efficiency of Distributional Temporal Difference Learning
item.description: Researchers achieve minimax optimal sample complexity bounds for distributional temporal difference learning, enhancing reinforcement learning algorithm efficiency.

item.title: Visual Autoregressive Modeling: Scalable Image Generation via Next-Scale Prediction
item.description: Visual Autoregressive Modeling (VAR) revolutionizes image generation by using a coarse-to-fine ’next-scale prediction’, outperforming diffusion models and exhibiting scaling laws similar to LLMs.
